Common Issues

Why People Leave T-Mobile

Rising Prices

T-Mobile's prices have increased significantly since the Sprint merger, with unlimited plans now starting at $70/month.

Rural Coverage Gaps

Despite improvements, T-Mobile still has weaker coverage in rural areas compared to AT&T and Verizon.

Credit Requirements

T-Mobile runs credit checks and may require deposits, adding barriers for many customers.

Network Congestion

In some areas, T-Mobile's network can become congested during peak hours, slowing data speeds.

FAQ

Switching from T-Mobile

Common questions about making the switch

Yes, most T-Mobile phones from 2019 onwards are compatible with AT&T. Your phone needs to be unlocked (T-Mobile unlocks devices after they're paid off) and support AT&T's LTE bands. iPhones and most Samsung Galaxy phones work seamlessly on both networks.

It depends on your location. AT&T generally has better rural and indoor coverage than T-Mobile. If you experience dropped calls or slow data in certain areas with T-Mobile, switching to an AT&T-based carrier like Vouch Mobile could significantly improve your experience.

Contact your new carrier to initiate a port request with your T-Mobile account number and PIN. The port typically completes within minutes. Don't cancel T-Mobile first - the port will automatically close your account once the number transfers.

Both networks offer excellent 5G coverage in urban areas. T-Mobile has more mid-band 5G (faster speeds), while AT&T has better low-band 5G (wider coverage). For everyday use, both provide significant speed improvements over 4G. Vouch Mobile includes 5G access on AT&T at no extra cost.

For families, Vouch Mobile offers the best per-line value at $30/month with no contracts. Unlike T-Mobile's family plans that require multiple lines for discounts, each Vouch line is independently priced. Mint Mobile also offers family savings with their bulk purchasing model.
